HST.071: Human Reproductive Biology
Course Director: Professor Henry Klapholz
HST 071
[H1] IN SUMMARY.
[H1] NORMAL MENSTRUAL CYCLE.
[H1] MENSTRUAL CYCLE OVERVIEW.
[LIST_ITEM] Purpose: production of a fertilizable egg and development of appropriate uterus for implantation
[LIST_ITEM] Controlled by hypothalamic pulse generator in arcuate nucleus
[LIST_ITEM] Pulse generator signal = Gonadotropin releasing hormone (GnRH)
[H1] GnRH.
[LIST_ITEM] Release is pulsatile in nature, once every 75 minutes
[LIST_ITEM] GnRH causes pituitary to release follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH)
[LIST_ITEM] GnRH and LH one-to-one: each pulse of GnRH causes simultaneous pulse of LH
[LIST_ITEM] FSH more complex, regulated by both GnRH and ovarian peptide inhibin
[H1] FOLLICULAR DEVELOPMENT.
[LIST_ITEM] Resting stage = primordial follicle
[LIST_ITEM] Consists of oocyte in meiosis I with single layer of granulosa cells
[LIST_ITEM] Maturation initially FSH and LH independent
[LIST_ITEM] Follicular maturation characterized by increase in number of granulosa cells
[LIST_ITEM] Almost all follicles undergo atresia due to lack of rescue by gonadotropins
[LIST_ITEM] Depends on number of FSH receptors
[LIST_ITEM] Contains no LH receptors until final development stage
[LIST_ITEM] During menstrual cycle, several follicles will develop to be sensitive to FSH = "recruited," but only one will gain dominance
[LIST_ITEM] Due to positive feedback within granulosa cells
[LIST_ITEM] FSH induces its own receptor
[LIST_ITEM] Estrogen dependent process (FSH → estradiol → FSH receptor)
[LIST_ITEM] Estradiol is inhibitory to FSH release from pituitary
[LIST_ITEM] Deprives less mature follicles of FSH → only one dominant follicle is produced
[LIST_ITEM] Note: in vitro fertilization administers excess FSH to produce multiple follicles for pregnancy enhancement
[H1] FOLLICULAR PHASE.
[LIST_ITEM] First half of menstrual cycle
[LIST_ITEM] Estradiol levels increase 10-fold due to activity of dominant follicle

[LIST_ITEM] Estradiol → increased LH synthesis, but inhibition of release → “reserve pool” is saturated → massive release of LH over 36-hour period = LH surge → trigger for ovulation (end of follicular phase)
[LIST_ITEM] Estrogen → hypertrophy of endometrium (proliferative phase of endometrial cycle)
[LIST_ITEM] Prior to LH surge, pulsatile release of LH acts on second ovarian cell type, the theca cell
[LIST_ITEM] Theca cell synthesizes androstenedione → substrate for granulosa cell estradiol production via aromatization from aromatase enzyme
[LIST_ITEM] Aromatase activity induced by FSH action on granulosa cell
[LIST_ITEM] LH receptor present at all time on theca cells; high levels of FSH on granulosa cells (a few days prior to LH surge) induces LH receptor
[LIST_ITEM] LH surge typically occurs 14 days into menstrual cycle (counted from first day of bleeding), but can vary 9-17 days
[LIST_ITEM] Second half of cycle, luteal phase, is more precise = 14 +-2 days
[H1] OVULATION.
[LIST_ITEM] LH surge → proteases digest capsule of ovary → extrusion of oocyte and granulosa cells (cumulus oophorus)
[LIST_ITEM] Oocyte proceeds to meiosis II, arrested until fertilization
[LIST_ITEM] LH surge → partial 17 hydroxylase block by remaining theca and granulosa cells → progesterone production → yellow color of remaining dominant follicle → corpus luteum (yellow body)
IN SUMMARY
NORMAL MENSTRUAL CYCLE
HST 071
[H1] LUTEAL PHASE.
[LIST_ITEM] Second half of menstrual cycle
[LIST_ITEM] Estrogen and progesterone dominated
[LIST_ITEM] Premenstrual breast tenderness, bloating, affective lability are progesterone induced
[LIST_ITEM] Progesterone → convert endometrium into secretory pattern (secretory phase of endometrial cycle)
[LIST_ITEM] Day 21 abundant secretion, optimal for implantation of fertilized egg
[LIST_ITEM] Without pregnancy, estrogen and progesterone production from corpus luteum declines → spasm of endometrial vasculature → breakdown of endometrium → menses
[LIST_ITEM] In pregnancy, embryo produces human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG)
[LIST_ITEM] Identical first 121 amino acids to LH
[LIST_ITEM] Maintains corpus luteum → no menses
